comments.text:
> you mean for performance reasons?

No, because you generally have to decide what selectors match to determine the property values.

For example, consider:

  tabs:orient-vertical { box-orient: horizontal; }

comments.text:
> why not just limit this case?

Becuause it's really difficult to detect, in general.  And more to the point, because it shows the fundamental problem: you can't determine the computed style until _after_ you have done your selector matching.
